RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduação em Scienze antropologiche - Università di Bologna (2009), mestrado em Antropologia e Etnologia Culturale - Università di Bologna (2013), mestrado em MIgration and Diaspora Studies - School of Oriental and African Studies (2011) e doutorado em Social Anthropology - University of Roehampton (2018). Tem experiência na área de Antropologia, com ênfase em Antropologia, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: eligiões de matriz africana, transnacionalização, antropologia da religião, relação humano-ambiênte, relação humano-animal, antropologia da alimentação.&#10;&#10;Faz parte dos grupos de pesquisa Cultural and Scientific Perceptions of Human-Chicken Interaction (AHRC — University of Roehampton, Reino Unido), Bewildering Boar Project - CEFRES (República Tcheca), e Núcleo de Pesquisa Tierno Bokar - Unilab (Brasil)&#10;Também colaborou como coletora de objetos relacionados a cultura religiosa afro-brasileiroas para o Horniman Museum and Gardens de Londres (Reino Unido)&#10;&#10;Pesquisa relações humano-ambiênte no candomblé, levando a cabo um trabalho de campo multi-situato em alguns terreiros de São Paulo e num terreiro localizado no norte da Itália.&#10;&#10;Atualmente pesquisadora do Musée du quai Branly, Paris, com um projeto titulado: &quot;Sacred Waste: tracing the trajectories of Afro-Brazilian religious artefacts in the age of environmentalism.&quot;
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: She holds a degree in Scienze anthropologiche - Università di Bologna (2009), a Masters in Anthropology and Cultural Ethnology - Università di Bologna (2013), a Masters in MIgration and Diaspora Studies - School of Oriental and African Studies (2011) and a PhD in Social Anthropology - University of Roehampton (2018). She has experience in anthropology, with emphasis on anthropology, working mainly on the following themes: Afro-Brazilian religions, transnationalization, anthropology of religion, human-environment relation, human-animal relation, anthropology of food.&#10;&#10;She is part of the Cultural and Scientific Perceptions of Human-Chicken Interaction (AHRC - University of Roehampton, United Kingdom), Bewildering Boar Project - CEFRES (Czech Republic), and Tierno Bokar Research Center - Unilab (Brazil)&#10;She also collaborated as a collector of objects related to Afro-Brazilian religious culture for the Horniman Museum and Gardens in London (United Kingdom)&#10;&#10;She researches human-environment relations in candomblé, carrying out multi-sited fieldwork in Cnadomblé houses in São Paulo and in Italy.&#10;&#10;She is currently a researcher at the Musée du quai Branly, Paris, with a project entitled: &quot;Sacred Waste: tracing the trajectories of Afro-Brazilian religious artefacts in the age of environmentalism.&quot;&#10;&#10;Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)
